thread.title: 5 perfect used cars for family travel with huge trunks and low maintenance between R$ 32 and R$ 68: Chevrolet, Honda, Fiat and VW offer economical, spacious and reliable models - CPG Click Petróleo e Gás
thread.title_full: 5 perfect used cars for family travel with huge trunks and low maintenance between R$ 32 and R$ 68: Chevrolet, Honda, Fiat and VW offer economical, spacious and reliable models - CPG Click Petróleo e Gás

author: Ana Alice
title: 5 perfect used cars for family travel with huge trunks and low maintenance between R$ 32 and R$ 68: Chevrolet, Honda, Fiat and VW offer economical, spacious and reliable models - CPG Click Petróleo e Gás
text:
Used options with trunks exceeding 450 liters and inexpensive mechanics are becoming accessible for those planning long vacations without spending too much on road trips or repairs.
Families planning weekend trips or long vacations look for vehicles with large trunk for luggage, comfortable interior space for passengers, and predictable maintenance and fuel costs.
In the used car market, options include R$32 thousand and R$68 thousand deliver capacity above 450 liters In the cargo compartment, soft suspension for roads and a solid mechanical setup with readily available parts.
models of Honda, Hyundai, Volkswagen e Chevrolet They appear on lists published by Autoesporte and Quatro Rodas in 2025 as benchmarks in durability and low operating costs for intensive family use.
Ideal vehicles for long trips with luggage.
These cars can handle highway driving with efficient fuel consumption and inexpensive maintenance, according to data from Inmetro and owner satisfaction surveys.
Prices verified in November 2025 on Mercado Livre and the FIPE Table reveal well-preserved units from the years 2015 to 2021 in this price range.
Below are five alternatives that prioritize cargo volume, comfort on long journeys, and real cost savings.
Chevrolet Spin minivan, practical for seven people.
A Chevrolet spin It stands out for its configuration of up to seven seats and a trunk that varies from 162 liters with all seats in use to 710 liters when folding down the third row.
Equipped with engine 1.8 flex with up to 111 hp and a six-speed manual or automatic transmission, it registers highway averages of around 13 km/l with gasoline, according to historical data from Inmetro.
The Chevrolet network guarantees inexpensive parts and simple maintenance, with costs below the average according to Quatro Rodas reports from 2025.
Units from 2018 to 2020 appear starting from R $ 58 thousand Available on Mercado Livre, these are ideal for large families who need versatility when traveling with children and bulky luggage.
Honda Fit modular hatchback with surprising space.
O Honda Fit The previous generation WR-V offers the ULTra Seat system, which allows for varied configurations, unlocking up to... 1.045 liters full capacity.
With engine 1.5 flex With up to 116 hp and a CVT transmission, it achieves highway fuel consumption close to... 14 km/l with gasoline at Inmetro.
Honda's reputation for durability keeps maintenance affordable and failures low, as highlighted in Autoesporte's 2025 reliability rankings.
Models from 2015 to 2021 cost from R $ 48 thousand, with a standard trunk of 363 liters which expands easily to accommodate strollers or vacation bags.
Volkswagen SpaceFox station wagon, versatile for roads.
A Volkswagen SpaceFox, derived from the Fox with an extended body, provides a trunk of 430 liters expandable to more than 1.300 liters with folded seats.
Versions with engine 1.6 MSI engines with up to 104 hp and a manual transmission deliver highway averages of 12 km/l with gasoline.
Abundant parts and shared mechanics with other VWs reduce expenses in workshops, according to Autoesporte's low cost of ownership lists.
Examples from 2015 to 2018 emerge from R $ 38 thousand, offering high suspension and good legroom in the rear seats for family journeys.
Fiat Palio Weekend station wagon, robust with extra capacity.
A Fiat Palio Weekend The Adventure version combines a trunk of 460 liters with reinforced suspension and increased ground clearance for uneven terrain.
Equipped with engine 1.8 flex with up to 132 hp, it achieves highway fuel consumption of around 11 km/l with gasoline.
The wide availability of Fiat components and mechanical simplicity keep operating costs low, as highlighted in research by Quatro Rodas magazine.
Units from 2015 to 2019 cost from R $ 42 thousand, with an external spare tire and protective features that make trips to rural areas or beaches with the family easier.
Hyundai HB20S compact sedan with a generous trunk.
O Hyundai HB20S delivery 475 liters with a trunk capacity superior to the average for compact sedans.
With engine 1.0 turbo With engines up to 120 hp or naturally aspirated, it registers highway averages of up to 15 km/l with gasoline at Inmetro.
The original extended warranty and growing network contribute to competitive maintenance, according to cost of use reports in 2025.
Models from 2019 to 2022 appear starting from R $ 62 thousand, with a wheelbase of 2,53 meters that ensures comfort for adults in the rear seat on long journeys.
Other variations of these models regularly appear on the market in this price range.
Everyone prioritizes practicality in family trips, with proven cargo volumes and savings on fuel and maintenance according to public sources from 2025.
Which of these models do you consider the most suitable for upcoming family trips?
